item.title: Ticket #1778 (MacOS FF1.5b2 wordpress.com web, create draft loses content) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description: Yes, both users that have reported it to me confirm that it is with the default settings, so Rich Text Editor.

item.title: Ticket #1020 (Presentation area shows raw CSS instead of Theme/Author names) updated
item.dc:creator: meganano
item.description:
Severity, Cc, Component, Priority, Version, Keywords changed

I've been looking for a solution to this problem for several weeks. I found a file called functions.php in the wp-includes folder and added the code as noted above exactly as it was posted and then again with the comments removed and the closing brace added.

function get_theme_data($theme_file) {

$theme_data = implode(, file($theme_file)); $theme_data = preg_replace(/\r/","\n",$theme_data); }

item.title: wp-1.5.2-patch_v2_xmlrpc.php attached to Ticket #1744
item.dc:creator: pidge
item.description: change wp_post_status attribute name to "post_status" (removed wp prefix so to be generic)

item.title: Ticket #1780 (post.php : categories sorted by id - expecting sort by alpha) created

item.description:
Greetings,

During wp-admin/post.php, the sorting of categories on the right seems to be id

I cannot see any option to let the system sort the categories by alpha

Am I missing something ?

note: I have already seen â€‹http://codex.wordpress.org/Template_Tags/list_cats - but

Cheers, Kishore.

item.title: Ticket #1765 (Simplify and standardize anchor syntax) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Owner, Status changed

Honestly, I have no idea how widespread support for id anchors on non-<a /> elements is in older browsers, so I used what I know works. If you can give me some assurance that <h2 id="preview-post"> would work widely, I'll gladly make the patch!

item.title: Ticket #1773 (Show progress when saving post) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
wontfix:

A better goal is to eliminate the delay altogether. Saving a post isn't hard, it's the Pingbacks and the enclosures that take so long. We've been trying to get these things moved around so that you're not waiting on them to save your post. A discussion on wp-hackers pretty much came to the conclusion that the whole "saving... pinging..." thing avoids the real problem.

item.title: Ticket #1774 (removing redundant line in source:trunk/wp-admin/edit-comments.php#2832) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Keywords, Owner, Status changed

Nah, that wouldn't have changed after the first echo. Nice catch.

item.title: Ticket #1779 (get_post_status() missing in Oct 20 nightly) created
item.dc:creator: abrazell
item.description:
get_post_status() has been removed from functions-post, thus breaking classes.php at line 592 on single entry view.

Temporarily added function back in from previous build to band-aid the problem. I don't know why this function was removed.
